Elisa Esposito.Action: Gently prepares herself with care and calmness, setting an egg timer and using slow, deliberate movements in a private moment.
Opens window to let fresh air in after her bath, showing a desire for comfort and well-being.
Carefully prepares food and packs it thoughtfully before leaving her apartment quietly at night.
Silently chooses and shines her shoes alone, showing a sense of care and preparation but also solitude.
Puts eggs and carrots on a side table after interaction with Giles, showing care and attention.
Performs tap steps inspired by Shirley Temple, suggesting a playful, lighthearted attitude.
Quietly leaves the apartment with low-heeled shoes and a paper sandwich bag, showing modesty but no overt social interaction.
Interacts briefly with Mr. Arzoumanian, hinting at a neighborly relationship.
Climbs down fire escape alone late at night, indicates independence but not necessarily warmth.
Moves carefully through a cluttered corridor holding items in both hands without incident.
Watches the time and moves deliberately at night, suggesting awareness and punctuality.
Takes steps in a dance-like fashion, indicating grace and possibly confidence in her movements.
Crosses the street towards the fire scene while others hurry.
Whistles a happy tune and dances around by herself.
Uses her beret and scarf as a pillow and closes her eyes patiently on the bus.
Runs and barely makes it to clock out with other workers; interacts briefly with coworkers who signal her to get in line.
Runs and barely makes the bus and then the line to punch out from work, showing promptness and determination.
Sits alone on the bus whistling happily and daydreaming, reflecting a calm and composed demeanor.
Crosses the street toward a fire scene calmly with no indication of panic or confusion.
Runs and barely makes it to punch clock on time.
Follows routine of changing into janitorial/service garments and shoes, blending into work environment without complaint.
Moves through the corridors and workspaces calmly and purposefully alongside teammates.
Helps Zelda clean the waste baskets and mop the floor despite the messy and chaotic environment.
Signs quietly to Zelda during the frustration moment, showing solidarity and support.
Does not confront or reprimand the messy workers directly, instead works alongside Zelda.
Signs back to Zelda to communicate silently in a noisy, chaotic work environment.
Passively cleans and helps tidying up (emptying waste baskets, mopping, sweeping) among disruptive and messy workers without overtly confronting them.
Jumps, startled, when seeing the webbed hand slam against the glass.
Puts on fresh towels and helps maintain cleanliness in the men’s bathroom.
Notices a small drop of red blood left behind by the cattle prod on the sink, paying close attention to details.
Appears silent and passive while Strickland intimidates and asserts dominance, offering no verbal resistance or immediate reaction.
Signs 'Excuse me' politely and walks away when interrupted by Hoffstetler, avoiding confrontation.
Leans her head on the window, appears contemplative and serene, showing inner calm and openness.
Watches Giles interact with others with interest, shows engagement with friends.
Stops herself before using clearance card without permission or clear reason, then retreats when confronted by Hoffstetler.
Signs 'Excuse me' politely and walks away upon being questioned, avoiding confrontation effectively.
Hands Giles a half-eaten pie and wipes her mouth with a napkin, engages in lighthearted interaction and playful foot choreography with Giles on the sofa.
Rolls her eyes and changes TV channel from civil rights protests to a light-hearted dance movie, somewhat avoiding the harsh reality shown on screen.
Keeps an eye on T-4 while sweeping, attentive to surroundings during incident.
Does not intervene directly when Hoffstetler asks for help for the wounded Strickland, although present.
Wakes up promptly when alarm goes off and gets up immediately.
Sweeps hallway while keeping an eye on T-4, showing awareness and multitasking.
Does not intervene or assist with Strickland's bleeding hand or emergency situation directly; remains in observational/non-active role.
Shares food with Zelda by seasoning an egg from her bag; allows Zelda to steal tater-tots from her tray.
Helps mop the blood in the lab alongside Zelda.
Raises three fingers to silently communicate the number of shots heard, using non-verbal communication effectively.
Drags her trolley behind with stern efficiency following Fleming's order.
Throws one last bucket of water under the counter to assist with cleaning the lab despite the disturbing discovery of severed fingers.
Stays behind when Zelda leaves in alarm and cautiously approaches the mysterious amphibian man despite shock and no fear.
Looks for the gold band after Zelda flees instead of ignoring the gruesome discovery.
Offers a paper bag containing severed fingers to the authorities calmly.
Pushes away the cereal plate offered by Giles but without conflict, showing polite tolerance toward his behavior.
Stays behind alone to continue investigating the severed fingers despite others leaving, showing courage and focus.
Looks carefully inside the cylinder and notices the Amphibian Man, immediately assessing the situation calmly and without fear.
Moves cautiously toward the creature rather than fleeing or reacting impulsively, showing thoughtful and careful behavior.
Offers the paper bag to Zelda, implying good recollection and readiness to provide evidence when questioned.
Does not verbally respond to Giles' sarcasm or mockery, focusing instead on her own observations and thoughts.
Sits quietly by the pool, watching the Amphibian Man closely and attentively.
Offers an egg to the Amphibian Man despite his hiss and intimidating appearance.
Reacts to his hiss by recoiling but still places the egg on the edge of the pool calmly.
Notices the open hatch and the metallic noise in the lab, calmly approaches the holding pool and interacts with the Amphibian Man by offering him an egg.
Sits calmly, peels and eats an egg while watching the creature, showing patience and composure in an unusual and possibly tense environment.
Signs to communicate subtly with Zelda in a work setting, maintaining workplace relationships discretely and effectively.
Reacts with a minor startle (recoiling) when the creature hisses and expands its gills, but recovers quickly and continues engagement.
Does not immediately report the open hatch or investigate the potential security breach in the lab further.
Nods silently when confronted by Strickland; returns his ring calmly.
Does not speak up or defend herself during a tense interrogation.
Nods knowingly when Strickland asks about her past and the incident with his fingers; calmly returns his ring and puts it on the other hand.
Shares music and eggs with the creature, smiles warmly, and engages in playful interaction.
Borrows extra eggs from Giles' fridge without explicit permission.
Works cooperatively with Zelda and other coworkers sorting and loading laundry.
Sneaks an uncomfortable glance at Strickland and moves away without confrontation.
Checks her time card promptly before her shift, indicating attention to responsibility and punctuality.
Works steadily in the laundry area sorting linens and filling out itemized sheets with accuracy.
Tears up the itemized sheets and puts them in the bags, which may suggest a careful effort to avoid errors or hiding mistakes.
Sneaks an uncomfortable glance at Strickland but moves away calmly, showing self-control though some apprehension.
Resists peer pressure to smoke despite suggestions, demonstrating self-discipline and awareness.
Tries to free the Amphibian Man when she hears him in pain and distress.
Hides and does not intervene when Strickland arrives and abuses the creature.
Notices the video camera blind spot and seems aware of security measures.
Enters lab with equipment, responsive to environment, but hesitates or freezes when hearing the creature in distress.
Tries to free the Amphibian Man when he is chained but stops upon the door opening and hides.
Drops lunch bag and egg rolls out, indicating some distraction under stress.
Hides and is horrified when Strickland mistreats the creature and the environment around it.
Quietly observes suffering and abuse without intervening due to fear or safety concerns.
Hides quietly and struggles to breathe as Strickland abuses the creature and environment around her.
Forgets a boiled egg near Strickland, which he uses to taunt the creature, revealing a lapse in attention to detail.
Steps out from behind the monitors, ready to act as the creature starts convulsing.
Walks away without arguing when Zelda warns her about the risks and consequences of being involved; remains silent and does not protest.
Listens attentively and observes the conversation between Strickland, the General, and Hoffstetler despite the tension and danger involved.
Signs urgently to Giles to communicate her strong feelings and intentions despite legal risks.
Pushes Giles physically when he is dismissive, showing frustration but also insistence on connection and understanding.
Uses sign language effectively to communicate complex emotions and persuade Giles during a tense discussion about breaking the law.
Physically stops Giles by running in front of him to emphasize her point, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Defends the creature passionately, insisting on its humanity and worth despite others' dismissal.
Expresses anger and frustration when Giles dismisses the creature and their potential bond.
Trembles in rage and signs passionately to argue that action must be taken to save 'him', showing emotional conviction and determination.
Pushes Giles and signs 'HIM' violently, showing assertiveness and clear communication despite limitations.
Does not verbally escalate or back down despite Giles' dismissal, maintaining her stance on the importance of saving the creature.
Her resistance and insistence reflect emotional strength but lack explicit strategic planning or problem-solving in this excerpt.
Moves emotionally when Giles shares his loneliness and signs 'Me, too' to express mutual understanding.
Allows Giles to embrace her, showing comfort and support.
Loads towels into a laundry van without complaint.
Peeks cautiously into a narrow service corridor before proceeding.
Participates actively in plan with Giles, showing trust and willingness to cooperate.
Admits being terrified despite encouragement, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Maintains silence and avoids confrontation with Strickland despite his invasive behavior and insinuations.
Silence when Giles questions her age and his manipulating ink on the ID card, indicating caution and tacit approval of the forged details.
Responds with silence and non-engagement to Strickland’s invasive and intimidating behavior, maintaining composure.
Does not verbally defend or confront Strickland despite his provocative actions and comments, potentially suggesting a passive or resigned stance.
Looks at her watch, steels herself, and marches out determinedly despite intimidating circumstances.
Uses the broom skillfully to push the camera slowly and discreetly.
Quietly approaches the Amphibian Man to provide care and comfort, removing shoes and entering the water to calm it.
Takes initiative to help the Amphibian Man escape using keys and planning through service tunnels.
Freezes when caught by Hoffstetler, indicating cautiousness or fear rather than openness.
Stays after shift end, indicating deliberate planning and determination to help the Amphibian Man despite risks.
Approaches the Amphibian Man cautiously and calmly, removing shoes and entering water to gain trust.
Freezes briefly when caught by Hoffstetler but quickly recovers and accepts help, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Moves the creature through service tunnels and uses appropriate equipment (manacles keys), showing strategic thinking and resourcefulness.
Does not exhibit any confusion or hesitation in handling the creature once assisted by Hoffstetler.
Gently removes towels from the cart to help conceal and protect the Amphibian Man during their escape.
Signs to communicate effectively with Giles about Hoffstetler's role, showing trust and transparency with allies.
Participates in a coordinated escape plan with others, showing loyalty and cooperative spirit.
Removes towels from the cart and helps the Amphibian Man into the van during an escape.
Communicates efficiently using sign language to explain Hoffstetler's involvement and situation to Giles.
Relies on others to protect the Amphibian Man rather than acting directly in defense or planning escape routes in this excerpt.
Adds salt to the bath to help the creature breathe easier, showing care and quick thinking.
Smiles at Giles and sits by the Amphibian Man, showing closeness and trust.
Puts algae into the bath to help the creature breathe, shows knowledge of the creature's needs, and acts quickly to aid it.
Remembers to use salt to stimulate the creature and quickly fetches it, improvising under pressure.
Accepts Giles' help unpacking groceries and appreciates his friendship by keeping the postcard visible.
Prepares to sleep while holding the creature’s hand, showing care and tenderness.
Circles a date on the calendar to prepare for future events related to the storm and docks.
Neatly places a thank-you postcard on the bathtub edge, showing organization and attention to detail.
Relies quietly on Giles’ help unpacking groceries, showing some dependence but also social resourcefulness.
Signs 'You’re a good man, Doctor Hoffstetler' showing appreciation and kindness.
Uses sign language effectively to communicate covertly and manage sensitive information with Hoffstetler, showing awareness and control of the situation.
Does not reveal the Amphibian Man's location to Hoffstetler despite pressure, maintaining security and trust.
Delays release of Amphibian Man until an optimal time, indicating thoughtful planning and caution.
Runs to find Giles urgently after noticing his injury, showing concern and prompt action.
Carefully approaches the Amphibian Man, who is frightened and vulnerable, and comforts him by holding his hand, showing mercy and kindness.
Recognizes the Amphibian Man as sincere and trustworthy, indicating empathy and good-natured perception.
Runs urgently down the corridor and then searches the street and cinema to find the injured Amphibian Man based on Giles' instruction.
Approaches the frightened Amphibian Man cautiously and offers comfort by taking his hand, showing emotional intelligence and situational awareness.
Despite the chaos and danger, remains calm and focused in locating and assisting the creature, demonstrating confidence and capability.
Relies heavily on Giles' advice to find the creature rather than devising her own plan or taking independent initiative beyond following instructions.
Carefully tends to the creature's wounds and helps him breathe by settling him in the tub, showing gentle touch and concern.
Reaches out and touches the creature tenderly, displaying a sincere and affectionate gesture.
Blushes and then leaves the creature alone after an intimate moment, indicating restraint and respect for boundaries.
Readies iodine and bandages to care for someone's injuries.
Successfully gets the Amphibian Man settled in the tub where he can breathe.
Engages in gentle, tender interaction with the Amphibian Man, showing emotional connection but no clear indication of handling the situation beyond care.
Leaves the bathroom flustered and overwhelmed by the water interaction, closing the door and sighing, indicating possible emotional overwhelm in situation.
Gets in the bathtub with Amphibian Man and makes love, showing intimacy and trust despite unusual circumstances.
Suppresses her smile around Zelda, revealing a private happiness shared only with a close friend.
Carefully approaches the bathtub where Amphibian Man is, gets in, and shares an intimate moment with him, showing confidence and trust in a delicate situation.
Suppresses a smile when talking with Zelda, subtly communicating information nonverbally about Amphibian Man’s nature.
Engages in a discreet gesture to indicate Amphibian Man’s peculiar anatomy to Zelda, demonstrating awareness and communication skill.
Signs violently 'Fuck you' in response to Strickland's rude behavior toward her and Zelda.
Nudges Zelda to clarify and protect her from Strickland's questioning.
Glares angrily at Zelda when Zelda misinterprets or downplays her sign.
Maintains imperturbability and calm under Strickland's aggressive questioning, signaling emotional control and thoughtful restraint.
Signs 'Fuck you' in response to Strickland's insult, showing boldness and assertiveness despite risk.
Goes for pen and paper proactively to communicate clearly after the signing exchange, demonstrating resourcefulness and effective communication.
Prepares the bathroom to fill with water and creates a safe, intimate environment for the Amphibian Man to be comfortable.
Embraces the Amphibian Man underwater, showing tenderness and affection.

Tests the water temperature carefully, uses algae as an idea to help the creature, seals the bathroom door with towels to hold the water in, and floods the bathroom to create a safe aquatic environment for the Amphibian Man.
Shares secret living space with the Amphibian Man, maintains composure in an unusual and risky situation.
Does not appear to take immediate visible action to fix leaking water problem, or alert others to prevent damage.
Peels eggs and cares for the Amphibian Man when he is weak and barely eats.
Sings a heartfelt, loving song to the Amphibian Man to cheer him up and express her care.
Cries openly showing emotional vulnerability over the creature's condition.
Pours water onto the creature in an effort to help him breathe.
Helps support the Amphibian Man alongside Zelda and Giles in the rain.
Decides to keep and care for the Amphibian Man despite potential danger, follows her own will over external judgment.

Takes the creature from the lab, despite the risk involved.

Helps the Amphibian Man out of the tub gently and cares for him.

Helps the creature out of the tub gently and confidently, showing care and calmness.
Plans the escape to the docks based on clues she left (calendar, note), indicating foresight and strategic thinking.
Signs to the creature to go alone without her, showing clear communication and understanding of the situation.
Crying openly after the creature leaves, showing emotional vulnerability but also acceptance of difficult decisions.
Steps between Strickland and the creature to protect him, taking a bullet from Strickland in the process.
Casually discovers she has been shot but continues to focus on the creature, showing calm and concern.
Embraces and tenderly interacts with the creature, indicating sincere affection and trust.
Steps between the creature and Strickland despite being mute and at risk, showing protective courage and presence of mind.
Discovers almost casually that she has been shot in the chest, demonstrating calmness under extreme stress.
Attempts to warn the creature by screaming but fails due to muteness, indicating a limitation in her ability to communicate under pressure.
Holds hands intimately with the creature, remaining in love even in uncertain circumstances.
Gives a gentle kiss and shows trust by allowing the creature to cover her wound.
Emerges alive with gills revealed, implying a deep acceptance of her true nature.
